sect1.title: Managing LDAP users and groups
sect1.para: Users and groups are created and managed with the dsidm command. It runs interactively, or you can run it on the command line, and enter all options in a single command.
List your existing users and groups:
sect1.screen: &prompt.sudo;dsidm ldap1 user list &prompt.sudo;dsidm ldap1 group list
sect1.para: List all information on a single user:
List all information on a single group:

In the following example we add two users, &exampleuserII; and &exampleuserIII;, by specifying their data via command-line arguments. The example server instance is named ldap1, and the instance's suffix is dc=ldap1,dc=com.

procedure.title: Creating LDAP users
procedure.para: LDAP users are your users that already exist. They should have Linux system accounts, with Linux logins and home directories. Adding them to your LDAP server provides central user management for your network. You need to enter accurate user data, which you can obtain by accessing the computers that hold their accounts, and running the id command, like this example for &exampleuserIIfull;:

step.para: Verify by looking up your new user's distinguished name (fully qualified name to the directory object, which is guaranteed unique):
You need the distinguished name for actions such as changing the password for a user.
Create a password for new user &exampleuserII;:
Enter the new password for &exampleuserII; twice.
If the action was successful, you get the following message:
Use the same command to change an existing password.

step.screen:
&prompt.sudo;dsidm ldap1 user create --uid &exampleuserIII_plain;\ --cn &exampleuserIII_plain; --displayName '&exampleuserIIIfull;' \ --uidNumber 1002 --gidNumber 102 --homeDirectory /home/&exampleuserIII;
&prompt.sudo;dsidm ldap1 account reset_password \ uid=&exampleuserIII;,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com

step.para: Verify that the user's password works:
step.screen: &prompt.user;ldapwhoami -D uid=geeko,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com -W Enter LDAP Password: dn: uid=geeko,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com

sect1.para: The following example deletes the user &exampleuserII;:
sect1.screen: &prompt.sudo;dsidm ldap1 user delete Enter dn to delete : uid=wilber,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com Deleting nsUserAccount uid=wilber,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com : Type 'Yes I am sure' to continue: Yes I am sure Successfully deleted uid=wilber,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com

procedure.title: Creating LDAP groups and assigning users to them
procedure.para: In the following examples, we create a group, server_admins, and assign the user &exampleuserII; to this group. The example server instance is named ldap1, and the instance's suffix is dc=ldap1,dc=com.

step.para: You will be prompted for a group name. Enter your chosen group name:
Add the user &exampleuserII; to the group:
step.screen: &prompt.sudo;dsidm ldap1 group add_member server_admins uid=&exampleuserII_plain;,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com added member: uid=&exampleuserII_plain;,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com
